text: On tap at moeder lambic. Hazy yellow colour small white lacing. Nose is hoppy, weizen like. Taste is low bitterness low sourness. Light crisp and refreshing hoppy wheat.

F: big, white, not long lasting.
C: amber, hazy, opaque.
A: very hoppy, passion fruits, different tropical fruits, hint of tangerine, caramel.
T: malt, wheat, mango, pineapple, grassy, hint of lemon, not sweet, tangerine, apple, medium body, medium carbonation, hoppy aroma is better than taste but according to style bitterness is low, interesting interpretation, good, enjoyed, 0,75l bottle from Proxy Delhaize Grande Haie in Brussels.

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontanais. Hazy golden with white head. Sweet malts, grain, floral notes, cheesy funk, goat, weird vegetables, asparagus. Light sweet and bitter. Medium body and soft carbonation. Nice funky dry finish.

Tap at Moeder Fontainas. Cloudy light golden with white head. Lime, sweet lemon drops, vanilla cake, light dough, cream, light grass. Under medium sweet with soft bitterness. Medium bodied with creamy feel. Nice!

Tap @ One pint pub. 
Pours golden color with a thick white head. 
Floral, citrusy, flowery aroma. Belgian yeast. Crisp, floral fruity flavor. 
Wheat, hops, floral notes, citrus in flavor. Super dry finish. Good drinkability. Very nice.

Bottled (backlog). Hazy orangeish golden colour with a mediumsized creamy white head. Aroma is citrus, some yeast, mild sweet malts as well as some wheat. Flavour is wheat, citrus, some yeast and a mellow floral bitterness to it. Very refreshing and actually a quite good thirst quencher.
Cloudy orange gold colour. Large, creamy head. Aroma is citrus and grass. Taste is fairly well-spiced with pine needles, banana bread, and a bitter finish.

Bière blonde foncée trouble à opaque, légère teinte pastel de la blanche. Mousse abondante, blanche un peu aérée, bonne rétention.Nez très fruité (mangue, mandarine, zeste), très léger malté. Explosion de douceur fruité à lattaque, les notes houblonnées se développent tout au long de la gorgée pour se conclure sur une très fine amertume. Touche herbeuse. Les houblons fruités américains sont à lavant-plan, soutenus par une base maltée gourmande. La touche surette du froment (typique de la blanche) ne perce pas. Ale plutôt douce, sans excès. Corps moyen, texture légèrement huileuse, plus épaisse quune ale blanche classique.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Bottle from Brussels at LarsCs with bager on guitar. Pours a clear golden with a small white head. Sweet and dry with aromas of pale malts and some pine hoppyness plus floral notes. Hints of banana. Medium to light bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish with notes of Belgian yeasts.

Draught at Moeder Lambic, small stable creamy bubbly head, very cloudy citrus lemon orange yellow color, citrusy, shrubby ,pleasantly yeasty aroma and flavor with some light wheat in the flavor, shrubby bitterness. Very nice and refreshing.
Flaska från Belgoklubben. Ljust gul med vitt skum. Lite kemisk doft med citrus och fruktig jäst. Lätt och torr, lite smak av skumbanan men väldigt diskret.
Troebel blond bier met kleine witte schuimkraag. Geur: hoppig, mout en citrus. Smaak: licht bitter, citrus en licht moutzoet. Licht sprankelende koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: citrus.
Draught. In aroma wheat, zest, floral and citrusy hops. In taste citrusy, bit grassy, dry and lightly sweet. Medium body, finish is medium bitter.

Tap at Moeder Lambic
Pours hazy lite orange hue with a soapy white head and great lacing. Nose is crisp floral lite tropical hops bouquet. Flavors of lite fruits citrus lemon and some nice grassy wheat malt base. Stellar hoppy wheat beer. Reminds me of when Gumball head was amazing and unique.

75cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Troebel goudblond met dunne witte schuimkraag die snel wegtrekt tot een ring. G: Citrus, tropisch fruit, wat kruiden en tarwemout. S: Licht hoppig, ook een zoetje, wat kruiden, beetje citrus en ook een zeer licht zuurtje. M: Stevige carbonatie, medium body.
Beer tasting @ fillepolo 4/8-16. Bottle from Belgoklubben. Fruity and hoppy with citrus, also some spices. Fresh. Body is medium, the finish is dry and spicy.
Tasting @ fillepolo 20160804. Bottle (750 ml) from Belgolådan. Fruity, light hoppy and citrusy, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and fruity.
Bottle from belgolådan @ fillepolos place. Pours a golden colour beer with a small head. Yeasty and fruity with citrus. Dry finish
hay, citrus, grass, pale, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bottle (75 cl) from Etre Gourmet. Hazy pale golden, large white head. Fruity aroma, slightly phenolic, soft tropical fruits abound. Medium bodied, mmedium to high carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness.

Bottle from Belgoklubben. Pours hazy in straw colour with a small disappearing white head. Nose has wheat hints and some hops which goes for the taste as well. Some fruity notes accompanies the wheat well. Fresh light medicinal citric notes and a short but enjoyable palate. A very summery wheat beer.

Bottle 75cl. Poured into a tumbler. Hazy straw golden, good two finger frothy white head, receding slowly, fair lacing; rich fruity aroma, wheat, orange, tangerine, mango, lemon, yeast; taste medium sweet and bitter, light wheaty, fruity; bittersweet middle part with a light sour touch, dry bitter hoppy finish, spicy and citrus notes; medium body, watery to oily texture, soft carbonation; fresh and crisp, interesting but not that special.

Impresionante cerveza que tuve el placer de tomar, de las mejores wit que he tomado en mi vida, refrescante, con sabor, paso muy agradable, puedo tomar y tomar de esta cerveza sin descanso, muy recomendable.

75 cl bottle. Hazy golden with a firm white head, dissipates quick leaving slight lacings. Aroma is fresh grass, wet grass, hay, grain, soapy, slightly orange. Very summery smell. Taste is medium bitter, initially sweet hints of orange, lemon, later growing hoppiness, yeast, rustic feel, fairly dry finish. Light to medium body, medium carbo. Excellent.
Murky orange with dissipating white head. Belgian esters, orange, spicy, floral and banana. Slick, sweet, hoppy, juicy and dry finish. Overall: Enjoyable. Probably great with food.
Citrus, grains and spices in aroma. Pours yellow with white head. Taste is dry with lime, spices and grains. Finish is low bitter. Overall very refreshing and drinkable brew.

Cloudy, yellow-bit orange colored, small white head. Aroma is of wit, coriander, orange peel, spicy, bit vanilla, some phenolic notes, bit peachy. Taste is medium- sweet wit, spicy phenolic, coriander and orange peel, bit peachy with the temperature, light+ spicy bitterness, bit yeast. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, creamy. Didnt get much hops. .Dont cool too much.
Hazy pale yellow. Aroma of citrus and coriander. Flavour has a good balance of sweet, sour and bitter. Some hoppy tropical fruits. Very refreshing.

Light blond with a pillowy white head. Aromas of floral, orangey, mango/passion fruit, white grapes develop. Fine CO2 effervescence, thin, faintly slick with a slender body. Brisk sweetness with a light hoppy bitter/astringency. Dry semi-asting finish.
Courtesy of Jaghana. Couleur jaune orangée trouble, légère mousse. Nez sur lorange et le raisin. Gout houblonné, raisin, orange, herbeux avec bonne amertume houblonnée fruitée en fin de bouche.

Bottle 75cl, a cloudy copper orange beer with low head. Nose is on orange and grapefruit. Aroma is on hops, grassy and orange like hops, good bitterness, grapefruit, lemon, ok but there is nothing exceptional in there.
Draft at Moeder Lambic. Hoppy aroma of citrus, pine and grapefruit. The flavour is moderat bitter. The body is medium and the texture is juicy.
Hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is hops and fruit. Taste is hopsand a bit citrus
On to at Chez Moeder Fontainas. Hazy almost cloudy yellow with a dense white head. The aroma is quite fruity hoppy and has some spicy clove notes. Mild fruity and hoppy flavor.
KØLF 111215. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is brett, malt, wheat, coriander, fruit. Flavour is hop, pine, grapefruit, brett, wheat, coriander, fruit, yeast. Nice beer.

Draft glass @ Ganzerik. Near perfect clean rich beer with a surprisingly reach USA hop profile, the wheat is complimentary & luckily features no wheat sourness. Perfect clean, super-refreshing hop experience. One of the better Belgian beers that I have had so far, I should have tried this one ages ago. Deep hazy light citrus golden with a creamy white head. Huge USA lemon hop nose, lovely, light non-sour wheat. Taste is rich USA lemon hops, same wheat, crisp, touch green grass, dry but rich body, light hazy. Absolutely beautiful. This warrant further visits & possibly an even higher score upon further investigation.

Tulip. Bottle. Golden, little hazy with big, semi densed, white head. Good head retention, poor lacing. Aroma is nice malty/grainy with light tropical fruits aroma, also a bit o yeasty character and some hay in the background. Taste is refreshing lightly sweet, slightly bitter in the end. Light to medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation finish is dry and mild. In general solid, refreshing and highly drinkable beer with nice touche of tropical fruits.

Bottle. Hazy golden with a medium sized off white head with good retention and lace. Nose has green hops with some sweet tropical fruits behind it. Lychee, peach, apricot, hay, golden bread crust. Smells good. Flavour follows the same lines with hay, wood, forest, dried green plants, bread, minerals, citrus. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium bitter, mild acidity. Soft and filling. Crisp, rustic, dry. New favourite.

Aroma:

Malts, hops, fruit, citrus, mango, pineapple, wheat. Smells like fruit juice to be honest.

Appearance:

Hazy yellow/golden beer with a small white head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium sweet and slightly dry at the end with malts, wheat and a lot of fruit.

750 ml bottle. Almost clear golden body with a big, creamy white head. Moderate in aroma, wheat, spices and some acidity. Flavor is quite light, but pleasant. Light malt, mild wheat, some yeast and hint of fruit. Medium body and short aftertaste. Fair enough.

Bottle. Pours golden with an off-white head. Aroma of citrus, amlt, fruitiness, yeast and grains. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some malt, floral notes, grains and yeast. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 750ml @ home
Pours hazy golden with a white head. 
Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, yeast and floral. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long yeasty, floral and malty finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Belle bière douce et amère. Houblon présent mais pas trop. Arômes ananas agrumes. Rondeur au palais. Bel équilibre.
VI jendrain wheat on tap at Porte Noire, Brussels. a lovely honey gold. Light bodied & refreshing the taste is fruity and wine like. Plum, apricot & wheat.

Magnifique produit dété.
Amertume prononcée mais pas agressive, le Simcoe fait péter le pamplemousse en bouche et son corps de "wit" apaise le tout dans des notes de blés très discrètes.
Une superbe longueur en bouche, normal pour un produit non filtré, bien houblonné et de qualité.
Bémol : des arômes qui varient que très peu. Bière simple. A plutôt prendre pour faire goûter aux palais peu habitués aux surprises.

750ml bottle. Clear, orangey golden colour with average, frothy, diminishing, minimally lacing, white head. Fruity aroma, yeasty overtones, hints of apricot, peach, mirabelle. Taste is slightly dry, wheaty, minimally tart, slightly fruity, hints of apricot and peach; super soft palate, quite watery overall.

[Draught at Brewberry Bar, Paris, May 19] 18th rating of my Paris/Amsterdam trip. Pours a hazy yellow-gold with an average size lasting frothy white head. Lovely aroma: Wheat, yeast, fruit, hops, herbs and a light tartness. Flavour is fruity, herbal and hoppy. Short dry finish. Average bodied. Very good stuff.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy hoppy aroma. Fruity wheat malty spicy hoppy citrus flavor with weak yeasty hints. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy hoppy finish.

Bottle. Hazy goldenyellow in color, whitish head. Lots of malty and wheaty notes in aroma at first. Tart notes follows after that. Feels fresh, but has a damp feeling over it. Wheat and mashed banana in taste with little bit of spicyness in the end. Refreshing one.

opalescent yellow colour, minimal off-white head; complex aroma of tropical fruits (mango?), citruses, barnyard, earthy notes, minimal bread and hints of dill; taste of citrusy notes, some bread, some dill and tropical fruits agin, as well as earth; good wheat ale
75cl bottle from cerveteca. Appearance is hazy dark gold. Thin head. Medium bitterness. Light tartness. Aroma is citric, wheat, light hop, spicy.

Robe jaune pâle. Nez puissant qui allie des notes de citron vert, de pamplemousse, de gingembre sur un fond de houblon. Bouche à lattaque tendue, bulle discrète, amertume marquée, longue finale sur les agrumes. Un bière amère qui se marie parfaitement aux chicons.
Bière qui nas pas beaucoup de goût. Daccord cest une blanche, mais il existe des blanches avec un goût plus prononcé.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, 20 Sep 2014) Hazy yellow colour with frothy, white head. Malty, clean nose with white bread, grass, hay and a touch of citrus. Malty, fruity nose with notes of bread, hay, citrus, grass and fresh hops in a finish with a gentle bitterness. Medium body, quite dry. Fresh and tasty. Quite nice.

Flaska från Etre Gourmet. Gyllengul, mycket disig med lågt skum, litte som ofiltrerad äppelmust. Fin väldigt fruktig arom och smak. Äpplen, druvor, ananas, tropisk fruktcocktail, lite jäst, vetesyrlighet, halvtorr. Ett lättdrucket fruktigt veteöl perfekt en sommardag eller till lättare rätter med viss sötma. Mycket trevlig.

The beer is pale orange-ish yellow color. Dull and flat from a fair bit of cloudiness - the bottom of the glass is just barely visible. Nice white head. The aroma has a lot of cider character. Quite fruity. Apples and grapes. Some light, sweet tropical fruit. Backed by pale maltiness and some dusty, Belgian ale-ish, saison-ish yeast flavors. A little bit of raisin, earth, dust. Taste is on the sweet side. Again, quite fruity but its a bit simple. Kinda washed out. Im wondering about the age of this bottle, though it did just recently come into the shop where I got it. Anywho, feel is light with soft carbonation. Decent but gets a bit cidery and sweet.

bon exemple de american wheat avec un équilibre trouvé entre le malt, le blé et les houblons.

quelle levure ? assez neutre...
pas beaucoup de longueur en bouche

A light yellow beer with a quite big and blond head. The aroma is mix of rich fruitness and tropical fruits, sweet papaiyas, some citrusfruits, hint of wheat and orange juice. The aroma is almost only filled of fruits, thats good. Taste is dominated by papaiyas, some spices and citrusfruits. Nicely smooth to drink even the carbonation is quite strong. Great beer, very fresh, papaiyas are dominating together with smooth palate. Positive surprise, I like this beer, a lot.

The third beer from this promising micro brewery, with a snow white, thinnish head and yellow blonde colour with greenish hue. Aroma of green apple, melon, lemon zest, sour yoghurt, straw, lychee, mango. Exotic fruits in the onset, wheatish sourishness, sweet touches, delicate hoppiness in the finish; very drinkable. I fail to see why this is listed as an Anglo-Saxon (not to say American) wheat ale here: this is just a Wallonian variation on the witbier theme and should be classified as a witbier. But quite a good one indeed.

Tap at CML fontainas . 
Pours unclear yellow . Good white head . 
Smell is bit spiced, some soapy character , bit sweet. Gentle and not intense . 
Taste is sweet, than graint ( corn flakes come to mind ) 
Touch of bitterness . Some yeasty character in the back . OK whitebeer, with way less spices than the average, and orangepeel nowhere to be found ... Certainly fun to try though

75 cl bottle. Hazy golden with an abundant white head. Hops take the overhand in the aroma, beating the typical yeast and fruit of a wheat beer. Floral, fresh like freshly baked dough, inviting, in the nose. Rather bitter and dry in the mouth, leaving the fruity notes in the background. The finish is a bit watery with a dry, somewhat harsh, resinous bitter aftertaste.

Bière wheat de 6 % abv, en version 75 cl, non filtrée non pasteurisée, refermentée, dont mon exemplaire est un an avant sa date.
Couleur doré moyen brillant.
Clarté nette. Bulles fines par milliers, grosse fontaine au centre.
Mousse blanche bien crémeuse qui nappe à 3 mm.
Arômes de pamplemousse, lichee, prune blanche, pointe de mandarine légère.
1ère bouche soyeuse avec une prise agréable en texture mais faible en amplitude.
Arrière-bouche avec du malt clair, jus dananas, pointe de cerise jaune.
2ème sur un doux ensemble malté, mais peu originale.
Arrière-bouche assez faible.
3ème sur malt et fruits blancs, pas de complexité.
Arrière-bouche uniforme.
La longueur donne une meilleure intégration, mais les houblons sont un peu heurtants sur lensemble.
La levure est douce, fine, un peu salée. Très belle.
Lalcool joue son rôle dans lensemble, mais il ne peut développer lampleur.
La finale ne dépasse pas le reste.
CONCLUSION : des efforts ont été faits pour cette bière, mais ils passent un peu à côté de lobjectif, qui est sans doute celui dune bière soyeuse au froment avec un niveau supérieur. On était sur la bonne voie, mais les houblons ont manqué à la tâche ...

Pours a hazy golden body with a medium head. Fresh and flowery somewhat funky aroma. Fresh taste of flowers and a light bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Small thin head. Slightly hazy. Yellow. American hops. dry. A nice thirst quencher on a sunny afternoon.
On tap at Saisonfest. Cloudy yellow pour. Aroma tart, vitamins, brine, funk. Taste is bretta minerals perfume brine shrimp. Creamy.

Bottle 750ml
Clear golden color, small white head. Sticky dry yeasty aroma. Also some fruits. Light to medium bodied. Apple, wheat, pear, yeast. Fruity but like yeast gone bad. Anyway drinkable. Maybe this doesnt age well?

On tap. Pours a hazy yellow with moderate head. Aromas and flavors similar to the IV Saison with a little sharper flavour and light bitter finish. Seems like the same beer with only a slight difference in hops/grain adjuncts.
75 cl. bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, wheat, spice, fruit and hoppy notes.

Bottle:
Clear, bubbly, medium gold with a small off-white head.
Aroma is lemon/orange, yeast, wheat.
Taste is sweet, a little funky, wheaty, orange-citrus...pear.
Slightly herbal hops.
Definitely Belgian.....very good.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Very light wit aroma, some spice, quite a bit yeast. Very easy going and nothing goes out too much, incredibly dry, and bitterness is just one sharp one noted. Quite boring, but quite refreshing.

Pour a very hazy blonde with a small but well retained head and some lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is peachy with a lot of grainy wheat notes. Its lightly yeasty and generally bright and fruity.

The flavor is very nice & brightly fruity, its dry, peppery & yeasty. The hop character lends much flavor but only a mild but well enjoyed bitterness. 

What a fun beer, straddling the line between Saison and hoppy American Wheat... cool to see wackiness like this out there.
Bottle. Light wheat malt and light orange peel aroma. Golden yellow with moderate head. Lightly sweet lemon-orange malt and mildly bitter orange peel flavor. Nice.
@ZBF. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Hoppy aroma. Taste is spicy and hoppy.

Bottle, 75cl. Pours a deep golden/amber colour with heavy carbonation and a fizzy offwhite head thats quick to dissolve. Fruity aroma with some wheat and citrus hints. Watery with little hop character, but with some complex dry malt and resin notes.

Pours gold into a tulip. Bright white head with medium retention recedes to skim surface leaving trailing sheets. Hay, funk and resin aromas. Soft with aspirin and hay upfront turning to marshmallow before the lasting resin and grapefruit finish.

Bottle. Clear golden beer with a quite quickly disappearing offwhite head. Malty wheat aroma, bready, grainy, grapes, tart notes. Malty wheat flavor, citrus, brett notes, hay, bready, floral, tart, some grainy notes.

Odense catch-up from the cellar. (unfortunately too old - re-rate!). Fruity aroma with red apples and white grapes, along with grainy malt. Dry and refreshing bready malty flavour with spicy notes and a little dusty touch

250 mml tap tasted on 04/02/2014 in Bruxelles. This is a fantastic wheat beer. The aroma and the taste is citrus with equilibrated alcohol and carbonation. It´s fresh and delicious palate. Next one please!
This is my go to beer when visiting Moeder Lambic in Brussels. I have not seen it elsewhere.

75cl bottle from beergium.com approx 47dkk.
cloudy yellow, small white head. euro hoppy, wild yeasty, malty aroma, a littlle straw and hay. not very wheat like, but in fact quite nice if You just ate too much food. Flavor is slightly citrussy, almost no hops, a little wheat, quite dry, no, or very little banana,
Bottle. Blonde. Soft wheaty aroma and flavor. Hints of vinegar, citrus and spices. Shortish aftertaste. Faded hops. Shy flavor and aroma..

Draft to taster. Looks solid; a transparent gold with white lacing. Smells hoppy, wheaty, and pleasantly damp. Tastes like it smells with a solid mouthfeel. Interesting, and a solid example of the style.

Pint on tap at Ei8ht Ball, shared with my sister. The beer was labeled "Jandarin IV Wheat, 6%". I believe this is the correct entry for it. Tastes lightly tart, like there might be a bit of brett here. Also a lot of that simcoe hop. Half hazy golden orange color, thin white head, couple dots of lace. Lots of good simcoe, citrus hop, light pine, good belgian yeast. Moderate sweet taste, nice light tart. Very good! Excellent, interesting hoppy aftertaste. Very bright and refreshing.

Drunk from 75cl bottle. Bought at the Malting Pot, Brussels. Very pleasant wheat beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle (750 ml). Almost clear yellow with a medium diminishing white head and little lacing. Aroma is slightly tart with acidic/citrus notes, hay and fruity notes. Taste is also gently tart with citrus, fruits, acidic notes, cereals and light grassy finish. Light body. Good carbonation. Slightly dry finish. Simple, yet effective. Very easily drinkable. Nice citrusy and tart touch.
Pours in almost clear orange pale, low head. Aroma is wheat honey, light caramel. Taste is honey sweetness, low bitterness. Balance towards saison. Body is light, refreshing, low carbonation.
Bier met een kwakje. Ruikt weinig. Iets hop en mout. Smaakt fris, zoetig en iets bitter.
Pours a weird yeasty golden beer with a good white head. Smells citrus. Tastes watery, fresh and citrus. Average carbo, thin body and a watery texture.
Pours pale gold with white head. Aroma is exotic fruits and wheat. Flavour is exotic fruits, wheat and spices. Citric notes are outsanding in the flavour.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2014 Aroma is more saison than wheat ale. Has that farmhouse fruity note with some banana and unfermented sugars. Pours golden with no head. Taste is very thin and watery. Some light bitterness. But generally it produces no flavor of distinction. Slightly perplexed as to its high rating.

750ml bottle. Poured a slightly hazy gold with two fingers of big bubbled head. A little citrus and some Belgian spice in the aroma. More Belgian spice in the flavor. Light bodied and dry with a good amount of carbonation. Very easy drinking. Nothing over the top, but a solid, well made beer.
Veel exotisch fruit in de neus, mango, lychee, complex. droog zoet, heel lekker voor een tarwebier.

Bouteille de 33cl @ B&D Drive In. 2e dégustation : la 1re fois trop zat!. Robe orangée au col mince léger presque inexistant. Au nez: fortes effluves damertume fleurie et minérale, de céréales de fruit confit (abricot?) et dagrumes. En bouche: wouaw, cest la rondeur biscuitée des céréales qui attaque la langue avec des saveurs de sirop de fruit épicé. Lamertume est légère et arrive en final sur des notes minérales. Le palais est sec et légèrement sure à la fin. On devine un amalgame de houblon américains. 
Du tout beau travail pour un bière qui se dit "blanche" mais qui sapproche plus dune" saison". Si on ajoute la levure, les saveurs sont exacerbées.  En résumé : un très bel équilibre entre la rondeur légère, épicée et lamertume discrète mais affirmée. Un seul bémol : courte en bouche.
Bottle, 2nd Tuesday Tasting @ De Molen. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Nose is wheat and honey. Flavour is wheat, banana, slightly hoppy. Not much going on here.
Hardly any head. Banana, apricot in the nose. Not a very tasty beer but fresh afterall.

Sampled from bottle @ De Molen monthly tasting. Clear a bit pale yellow to golden color, small white head. Aroma is quite fruity with some blossom. Fresh, slightly sweet, slightly hoppy taste. Light, but quite nice imo. Low body, light carbonation.

Bottle @ 2nd Tuesday tasting at De Molen, hosted by dEnk. Hazy yellow pour, thin white head. Aroma of banana, fruits, some Belgian yeast and some unfermented sugars. Flavor is sweetish, fruity and yeasty. Quite smooth and refreshing but a bit boring.

Bottle shared at De Molen tasting. Pours clear yellow golden with a small off white head. Aroma yeast, light perfume, citrus. Flavour is light sweet and bitter. Light bodied with soft carbonation. Not very exciting.
Slightly hazy pale golden, small white head. Taste and aroma of wheat with hints of citrus.

Bottle. Cap goes of without any hiss, not a good sign. Pours a headless, yellow beer without any canonization in the glass nor lacing. Aroma is yeasty, spicy, light touch of apples. Flavour is sweet, wheaty and carries some sourness. Im not really impressed by this beer, wondering where that high score came from.

Draught at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hazy hay yellow liquid with medium white head. Aroma of perfume, mango, white pepper, grain, bread and apples. Taste is dry and light bitter with notes of white pepper and perfume. Light bodied with medium carbonation.

ivory white head that disappears entirely and without lacing. straw-yellow blonde clear colour. aroma of citrus, passion fruit, mango and grapefruit. taste is wheat/sour, citrus and yeasty with a short aftertaste. medium body and carbonation. very refreshing beer, im not very fond of wheat ale but this one is really good!  bottle 75 cl

Large creamy lasdtin head and a golden yellow body. Aroma of wheat, flowers, grass and citrus. Nice! The taste is medium sweet, medium bitter and light sour. Medium body, thin texture and a bitter finish.

Refrigerated 75 cl bottle poured into a weizen glass.   Pours hazy pale golden with small fluffy head which dissapates quickly.  Little big bubble lacing, light body, medium/low carbonation, and really nice floral aroma.  Taste is long dry crisp hops.  I would call this a saison and I expected more.

75cl bottle opened as revanche for their last-minute cancellation @ZBF 2013 - Elegant and somewhat mysterious looking dark label that not nearly betrays a summer ale this refreshing. Pours a milky and bit watery straw yellow with short head. Fresh citrus nose with undefineable exotic and wit yeast undertones. Very light palate, tastes cleaner than other wits due to spices/oranges replaced by (mildly dosed) US hops (Yakima Chief Simcoe, anyone?). Imagine a Blanche de Namur as an entry level saison, thirst quenching and with unnoticeable 6 abv. -
Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma wheat citrus spicy and bittere hops flavor wheat citrus spicy and bittere hops

On tap at Apex, pours a cloudy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma of wheat upfront, light citrus and some rustic qualities. Flavour is full of wheat and rustic qualities, and light Belgian yeast. Very light and restrained on the palate and thirst-quenching. Great stuff.

75cl bottle from Cotteridge Wines.Poured light yellow to orange colour topped with a small white head.Lemon,yeast and floral aromas.In the taste wheat and grassiness feature quite strongly with spices becoming apparent after a while.Tasty,refreshing and easy to drink wheat beer.
Not so special as I expected. I thought this was going to be better because of the status but was quite incipit and with few aroma.

A steady pour into my large Tripel Karmeliet tulip produces a three-finger thick, pale, off-white colored head; it subsides somewhat quickly, though stays around, and leaves lots of lacing on the sides of my glass. The beer is a pale amber hue with gold highlights, but shows a brilliantly clear, bright, pale amber tinged, gold hue when held up to the light. The nose is expressively fruit with a ton of pear, hints of green tropical fruit, touches of kiwi, starfruit, honey-dew melon, and even some floral apple notes. The pear aromatics are the dominant note here, but this is backed by a dried grassy, threshed wheat, and pale wheat cracker like grain character. Hints of pepper, perhaps some pink ginger, and some lightly spicy phenolics help to add some complexity.

Dry, floral, pear flavors up front explode aromatically in the flavor. The beer is quite light bodied, extremely quaffable, and it is even a bit on the thin side. A bitter, grassy, slightly herbal, hop character adds some bite in the finish; in fact the bitterness is noticeable from beginning to end. Despite being dry, the floral and fruit notes combine to form a honey like flavor here. Mixed in with the hop character in the finish is a dried straw like, and even slight wheat cracker like grain flavor. Lots of tropical fruit character is found here; it is not the typical tropical fruit character from American hops, but instead is more like star-fruit, some kiwi, and some very floral, sort of guava leaning (but not really) fruit. The interesting thing about the fruit character is that there really isnt much in the way of citrus character here.

This has a really interesting hop signature to it; I never would have guessed Simcoe was used here, perhaps the dryness of the beer brings out the green-fruit notes from the hops. This beer is quite good in the end, I could wish for a touch more palate heft, as this seems even a bit light bodied for a Saison, much less a Wit inspired beer. Once it warms up significantly it picks up some fullness to it though. For me the totality of this beer adds up to more than the sum of its part.

My Bottom Line :  
Crunchy wheat and citrus fruit ride this polished brews prickly, sustained effervescence, leading to a levelled herbal bitterness. 

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A sheet of foam tops the misty straw golden. 
-The expansive carbonation is relentless; even breathing does not seem to soften it.
-The yeast character is very clean and timid. There is not much rurality in this brew.
-Light bread notes tag along.
-There are orange-y hints which must come from the hops.
-This is very drinkable and very well made, yet it is not as compelling as their IV Saison, imho.

Bottle.

Bottle at le mondiale. The wheat really disturbed the delicateness of this saison. The hops and light funk all seemed to be muddled into a wheat malty mess. It was just a slightly sour unhopped wheat ale. Disapointing.

Hazy gold topped by a vigorous tight-bubbled white foam. Aromatic both from forward citrusy hops and characterful rustic yeast. Generously estery, it makes a rather complex fruit salad when pairing fruity hops with saisonish yeast. In mouth, the bready, grainy cereal profile takes more room than Id thought. Even though it feels fresh enough and relatively light-bodied, it lacks perhaps a bit in acidity to be the outstanding refreshment it could have been. A slight huskiness is present, enhancing these attributes. Warming up, it seems to grow a candle wax side, more perfumey and powdery/floury that deters a bit from the enjoyment, so I recommend a cool serving temperature. The carbonation also feels a bit agressive, not being the foamy expansive typical Belgian bubbliness, but a constant small bubbles bite. Fun and original, but to me, less so than previous JJ.
Draft at moeder lambic. Golden hazy pour with white head. Light citrus and wheat aroma. Flavor is spices, lemon citrus, and light wheat.

A golden ale with no head. In aroma, a sweet frankincense, creamy, curacao, not bad. In mouth, a smooth incensed saison with sweet creamy mouthfeel, field honey, not bad. Bottle at Mondiale 2011, June 10 2011.

(Bouteille de 75 cl)  Le liquide a une robe jaune dorée.  La tête mousseuse blanche est petite mais durable.  Une fine dentelle décore le verre.  Le nez est superbement invitant : pamplemousse, pomme rouge, pêche et ananas se frottent à de timides fleurs et à des effluves doux de blé et de céréales mielleuses.  Les saveurs sont  succulentes et rafraîchissantes avec des fruits tropicaux, des herbes et quelques notes timidement épicées.  En bouche, le liquide a un corps moyen avec un pétillement modéré et une texture à la limite huileuse.  La finale est amère, complexe, épicée, fruitée, plus ou moins longue et intense.  En résumé, très agréable en cette chaude journée.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2011 750ml bottle from IPB.

Appearance : Clear pale yellow medium foamy head. Light lacing.

Aroma : Great wheat with fruits and light funk. Citrusy. Light notes of paint remover that fades away with time. Quite yeasty with dusty notes.

Taste :  Malt with bitter hops. Wheat and dusty yeast. Finish bitter with wheat. Hops are rather earthy and a bit floral. Nice wheat on finish, light fruits. Quite dry.

Palate : Very fizzy at first, a bit harsh. Much smoother after a few swirls.

Overall : Far from being as good as I remember the tap was. Very refreshing and summer-y but not as elegant as the IV and V. The light paint remover aroma bug me quite a bit too. A bit disappointing compared to the tap but still interesting.

Taste : Nice fruity passion fruits with wheat and malt. Finish is a bit salty. Light tart and funk.
